content.description: Start low on the middle with hands on a rock in the middle for an undercling. This route sets you up to dyno up to the rhino horn-looking jugg that is circled in light blue on the photo of the location.
Start low on the center of the boulder with hands on a rock in the middle for an undercling and go for the hold that is circled, from here you'll have plenty of holds to work your way up.
Start low on the middle of the boulder with feet on x, there's a rock in the middle for an undercling. Work up to the hold labeled with circle and swing out right to get over the top.
content.location: Park at  Lat 42.898109, Long -122.132960 and walk up to the boulder.

content.description: This route starts in the middle of the boulder with hands on a rock in the middle for an undercling.  You can use plenty of holds to swing yourself left and up and over the boulder with a jug
content.location: This is the location of a small turn out about a 5-10 min walk up to the boulder (Lat 42.898109, Long -122.132960). Other than that, the nearby center will be your second closest bet.

content.description: This is an 8 ft lava boulder at the base of a landslide area.  Fairly secluded off of Rim Drive heading south from the Crater Lake Lodge. It's a strong lava boulder with nearly every kind of hold imaginable.  Multiple problems to be found.
